strings.Value: "Your Grace! Gods be praised! You're our savior, you rescued us!"

"And not just me, but my people as well! Whatever can I do to show you my gratitude, I...?" {n}{d|Varn}Maegar{/d} pauses for a moment, as if lost in thought, then grunts.{/n} "Too bad Cephal didn't live to see this moment. And Gunderson... he wasn't a bad sort, just... impulsive." {n}Maegar nods.{/n} "We'll mourn them — mourn all who'd lost their lives because of Vordakai. And then..."

"What happened to my people... a terrible loss. Men, women, even children — Vordakai spared no one! What manner of creature snuffs out the lives of the innocent, it..." {n}Maegar's fist clenches, and he steadies himself.{/n} "They will be mourned, we shall honor the fallen. And then…"

{n}{d|Varn}Maegar{/d} turns to you, at attention.{/n} "Your Grace... by the debt of blood, Varnhold and I now serve you. The cowards from the North didn't lift a finger to help me when I was in need — so I offer my sword to the one who will." {n}He bows his head.{/n} "I'll head to your castle and wait for you there. A deputy will rule in {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g}, I'll appoint someone trustworthy, don't worry about that."

"As for the people of {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g}… I don't think the town will remain empty for long. Being in those jars…" {n}He coughs.{/n} "Let us say that it makes one miss one's appetites... including a warm body to share your bed with." {n}He winks.{/n} "I expect it won't be long before Varnhold doubles in size."
